jam.plot
Class Limits

java.lang.Object
  jam.plot.Limits
public class Limits
extends java.lang.Object

Stores the parameters on how the histograms are to be displayed. This includes

  • x channel display limits
  • y channel display limits
  • count range display limits
  • whether scale is linear or log
There is a separate instance of Limits for every Histogram. The class contains a static Hashtable referring to all the Limits objects by the associated Histogram object.

Version:
1.4
Author:
Ken Swartz, Dale Visser

Constructor Detail

Limits

public Limits()
limits with no histogram

Limits

public Limits(Histogram hist)
Creates a new set of display limits for the specified histogram.

Parameters:
hist - Histogram for which this instance provides display limits

Limits

public Limits(Histogram hist,
              boolean ignoreZero,
              boolean ignoreFull)
Creates the display limits for the specified histogram, specifying whether to ignore first and/or last channels for auto-scaling.

Parameters:
hist - Histogram for which this object provides display limits
ignoreZero - ignores channel zero for auto scaling histogram
ignoreFull - ignores the last channel for auto scaling histogram
